description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the remote code execution vulnerability in the Windows Wi-Fi driver (CVE-2024-30078), apply the necessary updates as indicated below:

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture (e.g., Windows 10, Windows 11) using `winver` command.

2. Download the corresponding update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64/32-bit): [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 10 (32-bit): [KB5039225](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039225)

3. Install the downloaded update by following the on-screen prompts.

4. Restart your computer to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This patch addresses improper input validation issues in the Windows Wi-Fi driver that could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely.
- It is critical to apply these updates promptly to protect systems from potential exploits.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system backup is current before applying updates.
